meanings.definition: To make proletarian in nature or character.
meanings.sent1: The factory owner proletarianises the workers by paying low wages.
meanings.sent2: The industrial revolution proletarianises many individuals who were once wealthy.
meanings.sent3: The fancy restaurant proletarianises its menu by adding affordable options.
meanings.sent4: The economic downturn proletarianises the once thriving neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The artist's depiction of poverty proletarianises the viewer's perspective.

meanings.definition: To cause to become part of the working class.
meanings.sent1: The new job proletarianises individuals who were previously unemployed.
meanings.sent2: Moving to the city proletarianises many rural residents.
meanings.sent3: Winning the lottery suddenly proletarianises the lucky winner.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected layoff proletarianises the corporate executive.
meanings.sent5: The community center's programs proletarianise the youth in a positive way.

meanings.definition: To give a proletarian character to.
meanings.sent1: The artist proletarianises the painting by depicting everyday workers.
meanings.sent2: The novel proletarianises the protagonist by highlighting their struggles.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer proletarianises the runway with affordable clothing.
meanings.sent4: The film director proletarianises the storyline by focusing on working-class heroes.
meanings.sent5: The music album proletarianises the lyrics, resonating with common people.
